intro: Otomeria tenuis, commonly known as the slender otomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Otomeria tenuis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
